1.content:
Frodo had just given Galadriel the ring of power. “You give this freely to me?” she asked in a soft voice filled with wonder and wisdom. Frodo replied, “Aye Lady Galadriel, the way to Mordor is filled with peril, better you take it.” Galadriel already shown with the unearthly beauty of the elves, but the power of the ring could make her the fairest in all the land. Let none speak of Arwen the evening star after this! But no, those thoughts were poison she could not except the ring. It would corrupt her and turn her away from the light of the Valar.

But what hope was there is Middle Earth? Sauron’s forces already were on the march and even if the fellowship did succeed in this most perilous quest she and her lands would diminish and she would have to fly to the west. Oh bitter fates! But here, here was a possibility. She would take the ring, freely given by this hobbit and confront the Dark Lord. Break his power and turn all of Middle Earth into the blooming paradise that was Lothlorien.

Galadriel warred with herself briefly, but this was too much of an opportunity to miss. She spoke kindly to Frodo, “Yes I will accept this burden, place it on my finger.” She extended her finger and looked down at the hobbit. Frodo trembled before this figure of beauty and grace. He thought to himself, she is wise and powerful and fair to look upon, no evil can dwell in her, she will use the ring only for good. Even though he wished with all his heart to give it to her and release the terrible burden it was a mighty struggle. But finally he forced himself to slip the one ring on her delicate hand.

Once on her hand Galadriel’s power increased ten-fold. To Frodo’s eyes she changed from the fairest and wisest creature in all the land into a Goddess. Awe warred with fear as she was simply too enchanting to look upon directly. Sam was also with him and both of them fell flat on their faces and wormed their way to her bare feet planting kisses on her fair feet. Galadriel was shocked at the power she wielded, her gaze poured across the land. She could sense Elrond in the halls of Rivendail pondering the events. She could see all the servants of the dark one. She saw the great lidless eye, and it saw her and shrank back in terror.

Her far sighted gaze ranged around the whole of Middle Earth taking in events from all the far reaches. Reveling in her new found power she ignored the two hobbits at her feet. She thought to herself and pondered her new found power.

I must gather my forces quickly. Sauron will bring all the forces of his dark lands to confront me before I can fully master the power of the ring.

Realizing she must act quickly she looked down at Frodo and Sam. With a terrible but unbelievably fair voice that rang with splendor she said, “It is good that you pay your homage to me little ones but I have things to do, fetch your companions.”

Frodo and Sam cried out in despair at no longer being able to worship even at the foot at this Goddess among the elves. But obey their queen they would, hastily nearly fighting each other to be first they rushed down and sought out Aragorn, Boromir, and the rest. The others rushed toward Galadriel, wondering what had worked Frodo and Sam up so much.

Long legged Aragorn arrived first, his mouth held agape by the sheer glory of Galadriel’s presence. Boromir and Legolas came next, but could do nothing but fall to their knees at the sight of Galadriel. Gimli, Pippin, and Merry could do no less either as they arrived, only Aragorn who held the blood of ancient kings could hold his ground. Galadriel smiled at them, and their hearts sang with joy that they could cause such a being so far above them even a little pleasure. It irritated her that Aragorn was not on his knees however.

How dare this man stand up in my presence no matter his lineage. Am I not Galadriel? Mistress of the Ring of Power? Middle Earths only hope!

“Aragorn I would oppose the dark lord, in order to do this I must have all the free peoples behind me without reservation.” Aragorn wanted to join his companions on their knees, but he saw the ring resting on Galadriel’s fair hand. She had taken the ring for herself! His tongue clove to his mouth but he summoned reserves of strength that only he Isildur’s heir could summon.

He spoke, “Galadriel, fair lady of the wood, you have taken hold or been given the one ring. I am on this great quest to rid that evil from the land, I would gladly follow your standard but I beseech ye, give up the ring!” He spoke fair and true, but the ring had already corrupted Galadriel’s heart and her pride stirred up immensely. “Foolish mortal man! Your doom is to die even if you are long lived for one of your ilk. You counsel offends my divine ears, beg for my undeserved mercy.”

11.content:
Aragorn strove against the power of her voice. Any mortal man, elf, or dwarf could not resist it. Still he fought the beguiling voice inside his head and with the resolve that was forged when he was told it was his destiny to be King of Gondor he resisted. Sensing his resistance Galadriel acted at once, “Loyal servants of your Goddess, take hold of him, he seeks me ill!” Aragorn had fought the servants of Sauron and the wild things of the north for decades, but his companions were seven in number and three of them were stout and valorous warriors themselves. His heart was not in his struggle, how could he draw blood of so fine companions now bewitched at no fault of their own?

With fierceness despite their size the hobbits too assaulted him, and soon he was bound with strong elvish rope. Bound head to foot he was left at Galadriel’s feet. With great arrogance she strode upon his prostrate form standing with her feet on his chest. “So will it be to all who resist me, I care for the people’s of Middle Earth and no one will stop me from protecting it from Sauron.” This was but an excuse, one that even Galadriel still believed. The ring had corrupted her and she would be the Dark Queen of Middle Earth, even if she still thought she was doing good and justly things.

She had commands for them. “Gimli I will give you a company of elves, rally your people and march on my fair wood, Sauron will strike hard and swift, Go now! They will see you swiftly from my borders.” Gimli knelt and said, “Aye fair Goddess of the wood and of my heart, I will bring a mighty host to kneel before you and protect this fair land.” She dismissed him and turned to Legolas, “Go speak with your people in the woods of Mirkwood.” Legolas gazed upon Galadriel, now a Goddess in his eyes, “Nothing will hinder my path, my people will ever struggle against the dark lord!” He leapt up and hastened to obey her commands.

Proud Boromir knelt and stood ready to hear his tasks. Galadriel spoke to him, “Rally Gondor! Return to your father and tell him a new power arises in the west, tell him if he would remain Steward to obey my commands swiftly! Or I shall place a new king upon the throne of Gondor. Aragorn whose chest now held up fair Galadriel shouted anew, “No Boromir, she had the ring do not send our people to ruin, you must…” His voice was cut off as Galadriel placed her perfect foot on his mouth gagging it. “Shut thy mouth, speak no more words in my presence.” Boromir saw the command and power of Galadriel and decided swiftly that she was the one who could defeat the Dark Lord. “Galadriel, you will have a mighty host of Men! The Dark Lord will quake in the halls of Barad-dur when he hears of our coming!

Boromir left with Galadriel’s blessing. The hobbits stared at the perfect vision of divine beauty and form. It disturbed them but a little to see dear Strider’s face contorted by Galadriel’s fair foot gagging his mouth. But on the other hand if he dared to defy their new Goddess it should be his fate to be humbled. In another part of their hearts they felt envy for his tongue was touching the fairest foot in all of Middle Earth. She turned to the hobbits and told Pippin and Merry, “You two, return to your peoples. The Shire is weak but not without strength. Rally companies of archers from all over the Shire and bring them south.” Frodo and Sam would attend to her pleasure, but for now they left her presence.

And now to humble this man who would be king. Ah but how to do this. He is too proud to kneel, so I will have to strip him of his pride and reduce him to nothing.

Still with her foot pressed firmly into the mouth of the ranger she spoke haughtily, “Might warrior indeed! An elf maiden has bested you and now you lay feeble and helpless.” She had perfect balance on Aragorn’s body and lightly sprang off. “I will break you proud Lord! You will be diminished and then I will warp your mind until you have no hope of disobedience.” Aragorn feared the lady of the wood at that moment; he at times had the gift of foresight and saw that this would be true. He cried out “No I will never obey you, my heart is given to Arwen of the house of Elrond and within me there will be no defeat!” He strove against his fate, vain that it would be, he would not be broken easily.

She laughed in amusement and his false hope. Galadriel lowered herself down to the ground and brought her face close to Aragorn’s. Her silvery white gown gathered beneath her and her piercing blue eyes locked onto Aragorn. “I will cast a spell on you to make certain your obedience.” Staring back he said, “I will resist it.” She smiled bewitchingly at him. “Can you resist the power of Galadriel? The power of my beauty, the power of the one ring of power all at once?” She paused for a moment. “Think you can strive against my craft while you strive for your life’s breath at the same time?” With those words she brought forth her hands and with one sealed his mouth and with the other pinched closed his nostrils.

Her grip was firm, power from her heritage and of the ring flowed through her. In vain did Aragorn son of Arathorn struggle to toss his head aside from the blazing beauty’s hands. No mercy was now in Galadriel as she pressed ever more firmly and spoke a spell of mastery over Aragorn. Her eyes glowed with power and Aragorn felt his will to fight shrink and grow ever smaller. Still he held his will within his own grasp. He was chief of the Dunedain or Arnor! He was so be called Elessar the Elfstone. He held on until his body was on the verge of bringing him into the peace of unconsciousness when Galadriel let slide her finger from about his nose. He breathed in the cool crisp clear air of Lorien. But no sooner had he done so then did Galadriel press her slim hand to his nose again.

Aragorn strove against the might of Galadriel. But his heart wondered, why. Why fight her, great and terrible she is, but her beauty is beyond words. He should be honored to serve such a great queen! Aragorn ruthlessly buried that thought, sensing it had come from Galadriel. Galadriel dropped subtly and bent her will fully through the ring driving home the thought of “OBEY!” into Aragorn. He fought and struggled and would have defeated the thought but pain seared his lungs, his attention wavered for a moment and so did he. Galadriel sensing her victory rejoiced and grew careless her hand slipping from his mouth. He breathed again, but only a breath before she shut his mouth. Her pale lovely hand a seal harder then mithril, it would not move again.

But now Aragorn blocked all pain from his mind and focused solely on not being mastered by the Mistress of the Ring. Galadriel’s anger rose at being defied and spoke harshly. “If you will not obey then you will die and the line of Kings will be forever broken!” Aragorn struggled again, but in vain. The ropes held him. His small gasps of air were not enough to sustain him and he passed down into the abyss and knew no more.

Has she slain Aragorn or will his torment continue?

She disrobed herself and placed her nude womanhood onto the elf healer’s face. “Pleasure me or I will use your face as my footstool every day!” Despite the horrendous odor the healer forced himself to orally serve the Lady Loradriel, hoping that Sam’s fate would not be his.
112112221.title: The healer tries to save Sam's life and ang...

choices: Set up a trap for the members of the Fellowship
Try and destroy Galadriel
11212.content: "You shall not break me as you broke Aragorn, I know the power you have taken, for It was by my craft that Sauron forged the One Ring while I was captive in Barad Dur" said Celeborn. He then ran from her, and even with all her great power, she could not stop him. All was not lost. Not all the Fellowship were in Lothlorien. Celeborn went straight to Gwaihir, king of the eagles and sent him to Gandalf's aid. When he returned, Gandalf was brought back and clothed in white. "What news from Lothlorien, oh Celeborn" asked Gandalf. Celeborn's face looked grim. "Galadriel has taken the One Ring" he said "She has been corrupted, the rest of The Fellowship has been enslaved to her will, she has sent them to gather their respective races into an army, to defend herself against Sauron" "We must go to Rohan, they may be our only hope" said Gandalf. He knew that Rohan, Mordor, Isengard, the lands to the East, and the land of Harad to the South were the only places where they could find a big enough army to destroy the might of the five races. "Perhaps we can get to the places and capture the members of the Fellowship on arrival" said Celeborn "I may be able to free them of Galadriel's influence" "We could overtake them before they get there" said Gwaiihir "But our numbers are too few to capture them all, and I would prefer not to go to war against my own people" "We may have to" said Gandalf "Perhaps we can free them of their corruption in battle"
11212.title: No he refuses the ring has corrupted her!

choices: Legolas
Gandalf, Celeborn and the Eagles
112121.content: If we go now, we may be able to catch Legolas before he gets to Mirkwood" said Gwaiihir "After that, we'll have to move swiftly to capture the rest before they reach their respective races" "Let's go then" said Gandalf, climbing onto Gwaiihir's back. Celeborn climbed onto a second eagle's back. Then the Eagles took off in haste. They were going so fast that Celeborn barely had time to register anything as they flew. They had captured Legolas before he had time to think. Legolas was unconscious on his eagle and he was trying to break Galadriel's influence. He eventually managed to break the rings influence over him. He woke up. "Good to have you back, Legolas" said Celeborn. "Wh-what happened?" asked Legolas "I was in Lothlorien" "What's the last thing you remember?" asked Celeborn. "Galadriel took the ring from Frodo" said Legolas "Then, there's a big blank" "You were under Galadriel's control" said Celeborn "She has control of all the Fellowship except you and Gandalf" "Gandalf?" asked Legolas, looking over at Gandalf on Gwaiihir "But, he fell in Moria" "Long story, anyway, you were sent to your people in Mirkwood to help gather an army against Sauron, I think you should still go" said Celeborn "Except tell them the truth,Galadriel is taken over, and we're gathering an army against her" "I'll do it" said Legolas. Celeborn's eagle flew low over the trees and Legolas jumped lightly into the branches. Who do we follow from now? Legolas or Gandalf, Celeborn and the Eagles?
112121.title: Set up a trap for the members of the Fellowship

choices: Radagast the Brown explains the plan
Legolas leaves to gather the elven forces
1121211.content: As a matter of fact, the tree Legolas had jumped to just happened to be the house of his father, king of the elves in Mirkwood. He was holding council with a man in a brown cloak carrying a staff. "Father" said Legolas "I bring news" After Legolas had finished his story, the man in the brown cloak said: "It's true, a bird flew straight here when he saw it happen in the trees" "Good" said the king "Thank you, Radagast, Legolas, we will fight with you against the Dark Queen of the Wood, but I must ask, how did you break her influence?" "I sense Celeborn's hand in your recovery" said Radagast "I also know that the only way that someone can get from Lothlorien to Mirkwood in less than a day is on the back of one of the Great Eagles" "You are right on both counts, Radagast the Brown" said Legolas "Celeborn broke Galadriel's influence" "We must move swiftly" said Radagast the Brown "If Galadriel has the one ring, she is infinitely more powerful, we must not only shield our ears, but also our minds, I think I can help with this"
1121211.title: Legolas

choices: Yes
No
11212111.content: "Bring me every elven helmet you have" said Radagast "I can enchant them to reflect Galadriel's voice and mind" The King left to tell a servant to go and gather the helmets. "How do we stop her?" asked Legolas "Galadriel was powerful before, with the ring, she will be almost unstoppable" "We need an army" said Radagast "Her following is great" "If Celeborn can get to the fellowship before they get to their homes to gather an army, we may have an army to fight against her" "And if we don't?" asked Legolas. "Then Middle Earth is lost" said Radagast "Sauron will enslave Galadriel through the ring and then we will have a Dark Queen and King to fight against" "You think Galadriel will join Sauron?" asked Legolas, appauled. "She won't have a choice" said Radagast "Sauron's ring will enslave her to his will" "We need to get her out of the ring's influence" said Legolas "Or Middle Earth is lost" It wasn't long after that that the king returned. Following him were a lot of servants carrying helmets. "Gwaiihir has returned" said the king "Gandalf is with him" "Anyone else?" asked Legolas. "I think there was a dwarf with them" said the King. Legolas's heart filled with joy. Gimli had been found. He left the tree house to find Gwaiihir, Celeborn, Gandalf and Gimli with them. "What news?" asked Legolas. "We have the support of the dwarves" said Celeborn "They are marching here as we speak, have we any way to protect against Galadriel?" Directing his words at Gandalf, Legolas said "An old friend of yours is giving us a hand" "Who?" asked Gandalf. "Radagast the Brown" said Legolas. "Good" said Gandalf "With two wizards in the army we might stand a chance" "I had a thought while here" said Legolas "The cause we're fighting would affect the Old Forest, perhaps we can get the help of Tom Bombadil" "I think we could convince him to join us" said Gandalf "Celeborn is heading for Gondor, but perhaps we could go to the Shire, I know how to break Galadriel's influence" "Let's go then" said Gwaiihir. Gandalf and Legolas climbed onto his back. Gwaiihir took off for the Shire. Do they make it in time to stop the Hobbits rallying the hobbits to Galadriel's side?
11212111.title: Radagast the Brown explains the plan

choices: The Eagles return to take Legolas Celeborn, Merry, Pippin and Tom Bombadil
Skip to Gandalf and the Eagles, going to free Boromir
112121111.content:
They arrive at the Shire just in time to stop Merry and Pippin. Celeborn releases them from Galadriel's influence and then he asked them to go and gather the hobbits to march to go to Mirkwood. The Great Eagles were providing transport as soon as they had found and freed the rest of the Fellowship "Lets go to the Old Forest and see if we can find Tom Bombadil" said Legolas. Legolas and Celeborn dismounted their eagles and headed for the Forest. It was only when they had gone into the forest that they realised that they had no idea where Tom Bombadil lived. "Where do you think he is?" asked Legolas. As he was talking, he realised Celeborn's silence. Looking around, he sae that Celeborn was covered by tree roots. Legolas drew his sword.

No need for that, my merry merry fellow
Old Tom Bombadil will sort out Old Man willow

Legolas looked round to see a small man in a blue waistcoat, brown boots and a feather in his cap. The man was Tom Bombadil. Of that Legolas was certain. Tom went towards the tree and started to sing.

You let him out again, Old Man Willow!
He is stiff lying here;they're no sort of pillow,
your hard crooked roots. Drink your river water!
Go back to sleep again like the River daughter

At the closing of his song, Celeborn was released. "Now, Tom has helped you, why are you a walking. Dark times these are" said Tom.
"We came to ask your aid" said Legolas "The Lafy Galadriel has been taken by the Ring of Power"
Tom's face looked grave. "Dark tidings you bring"
"Can you help us?" said Celeborn "She has taken over all the elves of Lothlorien"
"Tom will help you" said Tom Bombadil "Tom will leave his country for the first time in living memory"
Tom followed them out of the forest and back to the Shire. Merry and Pippin had just come out of a building with a large number of hobbits. Several had bows. Tom clapped his hands in delight at seeing Merry and Pippin.
112121111.title: Yes

choices: Galadriel will watch but wait for now.  Continue with Gandalf/Celeborn.
Galadriel will strike... but how?
1121212.content:
Gandalf and Celeborn flew on the eagles. Galadriel saw them clearly through her mirror, her anger was great at their defiance. Galadriel would make them pay for it but they were strong. Gandalf has returned from a battle with a Balrog and Celeborn had already defied her once.

As time went on she would grow even more powerful as she learned how to control the ring better. Still... to allow such defiance to go unpunished may not be wise.
1121212.title: Gandalf, Celeborn and the Eagles

choices: Use her magic to try to strike them from the sky.
Send Loradriel and a company of elves to attack them.
11212122.content:
This defiance would not be allowed to continue. She would bring to heel her consort and Gandalf as well.

She weighed her choices, she could try to hurl her magic at the pair of them in the air. Lightning and thunder could slay them. Galadriel's own magic was not offensively oriented however with the one ring even magics outside of her normal expertise came to her easily. It would weaken her for a time though and if Sauron chose that moment to strike... it could be risky.

Alternatively she could send her most trusted vassal. Loradriel. She could provide her a hunting party of elves and have her ambush Gandalf and Celeborn. Kill if necessary but preferably capture them and drag them back here to face the Mistress of the Rings displeasure.

Galadriel weighed her choices carefully as she continued to use the mighty Aragorn as her footstool. He gave a pitiful moan from beneath her feet and she smiled. She made her decision she would...
11212122.title: Galadriel will strike... but how?

choices: They manage to catch up to Gandalf and Celeborn.
They don't catch them before they arrive in Rohan because Orcs got in the way.
112121222.content:
Galadriel summoned Loradriel to her side.

Loradriel was every inch the perfect elven warrior. She was good with the bow, the blade and an expert tracker. Her eyes were fixed on the glorious form of Galadriel. Galadriel was flawless without the one ring but with it... she almost hurt to look upon. Loradriel knelt before the queen of Lórien.

Galadriel smiled and spoke, "Rise Loradriel, I require your service."

"Anything my queen, my goddess."

"I need you to hunt down my unfaithful consort Celeborn and Gandalf. Capture them alive if possible but kill them if they force thy hand. It is of the utmost importance that they be stopped, if the peoples of Middle Earth are not united under my banner the Dark Lord may yet triumph."

Loradriel's eyes flashed with anger. How dare Celeborn betray his queen! She would be successful. She would hunt him down to the ends of the earth if need be. Galadriel saw the determination and rage in her servant's eyes and she knew she had chosen wisely.

"Take with you a company of 50 elves and take with you my personal blessing. With the power of the ring I will weave about you enchantments that will prevent Gandalf's glamors from effecting you. In addition your strength and speed will be doubled. Go now and bring them back."

Loradriel kissed the fair hand of Galadriel and hastily departed. Quickly summoning her 50 elves she began sprinting for Rohan. They would not sleep nor rest until they overtook them. Yes they were on eagles but even the mighty eagles needed to rest and with the burning blessing of Galadriel upon them they would be able to overtake them.
112121222.title: Send Loradriel and a company of elves to attack...
